alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 3:20PM EST until February 17 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch, and snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, except locally 3 to 5 inches along the Route 11 corridor. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 1 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will likely begin as a mix of snow and sleet, then transition to freezing rain and sleet around midnight, and finally end as a period of snow Friday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Eastern Essex; Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton; Western Essex
